intro: Borreria amapaensis, commonly known as the Amapa borreria, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest region of Brazil. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing along riverbanks or in dense undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
